comments.snippet:
This a bit odd.

The bash shortcut points to `C:\Windows\System32\bash.exe ~`, but I could not find such file on my system! (and I do have that feature installed)

As a workaround you can open a Command Prompt (`C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe`) and then type `bash`; it opens the bash shell. comments.snippet:
The secret is to use the **sysnative** directory, then
```
File name : cmd
Arguments : /K c:\windows\sysnative\wsl
```

```
File name : cmd
Arguments : /K c:\windows\sysnative\bash
```

Pascal
